contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=June 2008}} {{Infobox album<!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Japanese Whispers:<br />The Cure Singles Nov 82: Nov 83 | Type = [[Compilation album]] | Artist = [[The Cure]] | Cover = Jwhispers.jpg | Released = December 6, 1983 | Recorded = November 1982 - April 1983 | Genre = [[New wave music|New wave]] | Length = 28:27 | Label = [[Fiction Records|Fiction]] (UK), [[Sire Records|Sire]] (U.S.) | Producer = [[Chris Parry (producer)|Chris Parry]], [[Steve Nye]], [[Robert Smith (musician)|Robert Smith]], [[Phil Thornalley]] | Chronology = [[The Cure]] compilations | Last album = ''[[Happily Ever After (The Cure album)|Happily Ever After]]''<br />(1981) | This album = '''''Japanese Whispers'''''<br />(1983) | Next album = ''[[Standing on a Beach]]''<br />(1986) | Misc = {{Singles | Name = Japanese Whispers | Type = studio | single 1 = [[Let's Go to Bed (The Cure song)|Let's Go to Bed]] | single 1 date = November 23, 1982 | single 2 = [[The Walk (The Cure song)|The Walk]] | single 2 date = July 5, 1983 | single 3 = [[The Love Cats (song)|The Love Cats]] | single 3 date = October 18, 1983 }} }} {{Album ratings |rev1 = [[AllMusic]] |rev1score = {{Rating|3|5}}<ref>{{cite web|url={{Allmusic|class=album|id=r4922|pure_url=yes}}|title=Japanese Whispers - The Cure|last=True|first=Chris|publisher=[[AllMusic]]}}</ref> |rev2 = ''[[The Rolling Stone Album Guide]]'' |rev2Score = {{Rating|4|5}}<ref>[http://www.rollingstone.com/music/artists/the-cure/albumguide Rolling Stone Album Guide]</ref> |rev3 = [[Sputnikmusic]] |rev3score = {{Rating|2.5|5}}<ref>[http://sputnikmusic.com/review/44449/The-Cure-Japanese-Whispers/ Sputnikmusic review]</ref> }} '''''Japanese Whispers: The Cure Singles Nov 82: Nov 83''''' is a singles album by [[United Kingdom|British]] [[musical group|group]] [[The Cure]]. It was released in late 1983 by their [[record company]], [[Fiction Records]]. It includes the [[single (music)|singles]] "Let's Go to Bed", "The Walk" and "The Lovecats". Two other tracks are the [[A-side and B-side|B-side]]s of these singles, although "Mr. Pink Eyes" (the second B-side for "The Lovecats") was not included. The songs were recorded when the band was in a transitional phase after [[bassist]] [[Simon Gallup]] left following a tour to promote the previous album, ''[[Pornography (album)|Pornography]]''. Beginning with these singles, [[Lol Tolhurst]] switched from [[drum kit|drums]] to [[keyboard instrument|keyboards]], a role he kept until his departure in 1989. For first two singles' tracks The Cure is a duo consisting of Tolhurst and [[Robert Smith (musician)|Robert Smith]], with the addition of a session [[drummer]] for the tracks from "Let's Go to Bed". For the last single, a full band was assembled with the addition of [[bassist]]/[[record producer|producer]] [[Phil Thornalley]], who had worked with the band on ''Pornography'', and drummer [[Andy Anderson (drummer)|Andy Anderson]], a lineup which would continue for the ''[[Concert (album)|Concert]]'' [[live album]]. In 1986, the singles' lead tracks were included in the ''[[Staring at the Sea]]'' [[compilation album]], while all of the B-sides have been included in the 2004 B-sides and rarities [[box set]] ''[[Join the Dots: B-Sides and Rarities, 1978-2001 (The Fiction Years)|Join The Dots]]''. ==Track listing== All tracks written by Robert Smith and Laurence Tolhurst except as noted. # "[[Let's Go to Bed (The Cure song)|Let's Go to Bed]]" – 3:34 # "The Dream" (Smith) – 3:13 # "Just One Kiss" – 4:09 # "The Upstairs Room" – 3:31 # "[[The Walk (The Cure song)|The Walk]]" – 3:30 # "Speak My Language" – 2:41 # "Lament" (Smith) – 4:20 # "[[The Love Cats (song)|The Love Cats]]" (Smith) – 3:40 == Personnel == *[[Robert Smith (musician)|Robert Smith]]- [[singing|vocals]], [[guitar]]s, [[keyboard instrument|keyboards]], [[bass guitar]] *[[Lol Tolhurst]] - keyboards, [[drum machine]] *[[Steve Goulding]] - drums (1, 3) *[[Phil Thornalley]] - bass (6, 8) *[[Andy Anderson (musician)|Andy Anderson]] - drums (6, 8) ==References== {{reflist}} {{The Cure}} {{The Cure singles}} [[Category:1983 compilation albums]] [[Category:The Cure albums]] [[Category:Fiction Records compilation albums]] [[Category:Sire Records compilation albums]]
